xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Functions for inspecting XQuery modules and functions
Returns an XML fragment describing the function referenced by the passed function item.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: node() : the signature of the function

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Compiles a library module from source (without importing it) and returns an XML fragment describing the module and the functions/variables contained in it.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $location The location URI of the module to inspect
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: element()? : An XML fragment describing the module and all functions contained in it.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns an XML fragment describing the library module identified by the given namespace URI and the functions/variables contained in it.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $uri The namespace URI of the module to inspect
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: element()? : An XML fragment describing the module and all functions contained in it.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a sequence of function items pointing to each public function in the current module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: function(*)* : Sequence of function items containing all public functions in the current module or the empty sequence if the module is not known in the current context.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a sequence of function items pointing to each public function in the specified module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $location The location URI of the module to be loaded.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: function(*)* : Sequence of function items containing all public functions in the module or the empty sequence if the module is not known in the current context.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a sequence of function items pointing to each public function in the specified module.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $uri The URI of the module to be loaded.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: function(*)* : Sequence of function items containing all public functions in the module or the empty sequence if the module is not known in the current context.
